title: N03-1026

sentences.text: We present an application of ambiguity packing and stochastic disambiguation techniques for Lexical-Functional Grammars -LRB- LFG -RRB- to the domain of sentence condensation .

Our system incorporates a linguistic parser/generator for LFG , a transfer component for parse reduction operating on packed parse forests , and a maximum-entropy model for stochastic output selection .
Furthermore , we propose the use of standard parser evaluation methods for automatically evaluating the summarization quality of sentence condensation systems .
An experimental evaluation of summarization quality shows a close correlation between the automatic parse-based evaluation and a manual evaluation of generated strings .
Overall summarization quality of the proposed system is state-of-the-art , with guaranteed grammaticality of the system output due to the use of a constraint-based parser/generator .

summary: We present an application of ambiguity packing and stochastic disambiguation techniques for Lexical-Functional Grammars -LRB- LFG -RRB- to the domain of sentence condensation . Our system incorporates a linguistic parser/generator for LFG , a transfer component for parse reduction operating on packed parse forests , and a maximum-entropy model for stochastic output selection . Furthermore , we propose the use of standard parser evaluation methods for automatically evaluating the summarization quality of sentence condensation systems . An experimental evaluation of summarization quality shows a close correlation between the automatic parse-based evaluation and a manual evaluation of generated strings . Overall summarization quality of the proposed system is state-of-the-art , with guaranteed grammaticality of the system output due to the use of a constraint-based parser/generator .

Predicate-incorporates.label: incorporates
Predicate-incorporates.description: The predicate 'incorporates' indicates that the subject has integrated or combined with something to form a unified whole. This integration can be of various types, such as combining different components into a single system, incorporating new features or functionalities, or merging distinct entities into a cohesive unit.

Predicate-evaluate.label: evaluate
Predicate-evaluate.description: To evaluate means to assess or judge the value, accuracy, or effectiveness of something based on certain criteria or standards. The subject performs an evaluation process that connects them with the object, which represents a specific aspect or characteristic being evaluated.

Predicate-correlates_with.label: correlates with
Predicate-correlates_with.description: Indicates a relationship where two entities or methods are connected by sharing similar characteristics, patterns, or outcomes. The subject and object are linked through their correlation, suggesting that they have some degree of similarity, equivalence, or parallelism.

Predicate-is.label: is
Predicate-is.description: The predicate 'is' indicates a relationship of equivalence or identity between the subject and object. It suggests that the subject possesses or embodies the characteristics, properties, or state described by the object.

Predicate-has.label: has
Predicate-has.description: The predicate 'has' indicates a state or property that exists in relation to its subject. It suggests possession, ownership, or association between the subject and object, implying that the subject has acquired, possesses, or exhibits the quality or characteristic described by the object.

Predicate-applies_to.label: applies to
Predicate-applies_to.description: The predicate 'applies to' indicates a relationship between two entities, where the subject (the proposed system or any other entity that can be considered as applying something) uses or employs the object (a specific technique, method, domain, etc.) for a particular purpose.

Predicate-present.label: present
Predicate-present.description: The predicate 'present' indicates a relationship where the subject conveys or offers something, often in an official or formal manner. The object represents what is being presented, which can be ideas, techniques, methods, or other forms of knowledge. In general, this predicate connects the subject to the object by highlighting their role as providers or conveyors of information.

skos:broader.label: has a broader term
skos:broader.description: Indicates that the subject concept is more specific than or equivalent to the object concept. This predicate establishes a hierarchical relationship between two concepts, where the subject is a narrower term and the object is a broader term.
